premises: If the forest is healthy, then biodiversity is high
incorrect conclusions: Biodiversity implies that the forest is healthy
Not biodiversity implies that the forest is healthy
Not the forest is healthy implies that not biodiversity is high

premises: If the lake is polluted, then fish population decreases
incorrect conclusions: Fish population decrease implies that the lake is polluted
Not fish population decrease implies that the lake is polluted
Not the lake is polluted implies that not fish population decreases

premises: If the climate changes, then animal migration patterns alter
incorrect conclusions: Animal migration patterns do not alter
Animal migration patterns alter implies that the climate changes
Not animal migration patterns alter implies that the climate changes
Not the climate changes implies that not animal migration patterns alter
